## Introduction
Stovetop Simple Tomato Sauce is a versatile and flavorful sauce that can be used in a variety of dishes. It is a staple in Italian cuisine and adds a burst of tangy and savory flavor to pasta, pizzas, and more. This recipe uses basic ingredients and can be easily customized to suit your taste preferences.

## Ingredients
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- Salt and pepper to taste

## Equipment
- Large saucepan
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Knife
- Cutting board

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 30 minutes

## Steps
1. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the saucepan. Cook until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic is fragrant, stirring occasionally.
3. Pour the crushed tomatoes into the saucepan and stir well.
4. Add the dried basil, dried oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper to the saucepan. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the saucepan with a lid and let it cook for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning if needed. If you prefer a smoother sauce, you can use an immersion blender to puree it.
7. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the sauce cool slightly before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Stovetop Simple Tomato Sauce over your favorite pasta, such as spaghetti or penne.
- Use the sauce as a base for homemade pizzas. Spread it on the pizza dough and top with your favorite toppings before baking.
- Add the sauce to meatballs or chicken Parmesan for a flavorful twist.
- Use the sauce as a dipping sauce for garlic bread or mozzarella sticks.

## Variations
- For a chunkier sauce, use diced tomatoes instead of crushed tomatoes.
- Add cooked ground beef or Italian sausage to the sauce for a meaty version.
- Customize the herbs by adding fresh basil, parsley, or thyme for additional flavor.
- For a spicy kick, add red pepper flakes or a dash of hot sauce.

## Tips and Tricks
- Use a wooden spoon or spatula to stir the sauce to prevent scratching the bottom of the saucepan.
- If the sauce is too acidic, add a pinch of sugar to balance the flavors.
- Make a double batch of the sauce and freeze the leftovers in portion-sized containers for future use.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for Stovetop Simple Tomato Sauce will vary depending on the specific brands and quantities of ingredients used. Here is a general approximation per serving:
  - Calories: 80
  - Fat: 5g
  - Carbohydrates: 8g
  - Protein: 2g
  - Fiber: 2g
  - Sodium: 200mg

## Storage and Leftovers
- Allow the sauce to cool completely before storing it in an airtight container.
- The Stovetop Simple Tomato Sauce can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
- You can also freeze the sauce for up to 3 months. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I use fresh tomatoes instead of canned tomatoes?
  - Yes, you can use fresh tomatoes. Simply blanch them in boiling water for a few minutes, then peel and crush them before adding to the saucepan.
- Can I use this sauce for canning?
  - This recipe is not designed for canning. If you want to preserve the sauce for long-term storage, it is recommended to follow a specific canning recipe and process.
- Can I make the sauce in advance?
  - Yes, you can make the sauce in advance and store it in the refrigerator or freezer until needed. It will even taste better the next day as the flavors develop further.
